sn36.31:1.1: “Of the flesh” is sāmisa, used of a sacrifice where meat is included (Manu 4.131). This discourse offers a detailed analysis of this term.
sn36.31:3.1: “Even more spiritual than that not of the flesh” is nirāmisā nirāmisatarā.
sn36.31:10.2: This shows that sāmisa is a relative term. Compared to other feelings, absorption is “not of the flesh”, but compared to other liberations, the four absorptions are “of the flesh”. The commentary explains that this is so because they are still based on “form”, namely the reflection or counterpart experienced as a light or vision in the mind.
